meanings.definition: To take back or recover possession of (something)
meanings.sent1: She is retaking her book from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He retaking his toy from his friend.
meanings.sent3: The cat keeps retaking the same toy from the dog.
meanings.sent4: The student is retaking control of his grades.
meanings.sent5: The sun retaking its place in the sky after the storm.

meanings.definition: The act of taking something back or regaining possession of it
meanings.sent1: The retaking of the lost treasure was a joyous event.
meanings.sent2: His retaking of the stolen bike was a relief.
meanings.sent3: The retaking of the remote control was a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: The retaking of the throne was a momentous occasion.
meanings.sent5: The retaking of the championship trophy was a proud moment for the team.
